intro: Zaluzianskia polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of purple and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and bears clusters of small, yellow fruits that mature into inflated, seed-containing pods. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Zaluzianskia polycarpa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing food for various pollinators.
